items.title: My November 2023 Media Diet
items.content_html:
I am a huge fan of Jason Kottke and his website, kottke.org. Periodically, Jason posts a summary of what he’s been watching, reading, playing, and doing. I look forward to these posts and thought it would be fun to start doing the same.

I am hoping that writing about the content I consume will allow me to reflect on and remember more of what I enjoy (or don’t enjoy).

So without further ado, here is what I’ve been up to the past month:

ğŸ¿ Nosferatu. Somehow I had never seen Nosferatu prior to this. Nitehawk Theater screened a restoration with a live score played by a band on Halloween night. It was the perfect way to see it for the first time. (ğŸ‘ğŸ¼)

ğŸ“º Our Flag Means Death. Love this show. Very sweet, very fun. Taikaâ€™s comedic timing is unmatched. Iâ€™m hoping it gets picked up for a third season but they ended this one in a way thatâ€™s fitting even if it does not. (ğŸ‘ğŸ¼)

ğŸ“º The Sopranos. I was very late to the game despite loving all things organized crime. What is there to say that hasnâ€™t already been said about Tony Soprano and the rest of the ensemble cast that makes up this show? James Gandolfini embodies Tony Soprano in a way that so many actors wish they could emulate but can never achieve. The show isnâ€™t perfect but it has quickly climbed to one of the top spots in my favorite shows of all time list. (â¤ï¸)

ğŸ“º Pluto. I have never read or watched any Astro Boy content before this. Pluto was a wonderful take on robots / AI coming to terms with its own humanity. Iâ€™d love to watch more content in this vein. Pluto reminded me of a cross between Blade Runner and Neon Genesis Evangelion. (ğŸ‘ğŸ¼)

ğŸ“– The War Of The Worlds by H.G. Wells. I try to read a few â€œclassicsâ€ every year. I did not realize this was written in 1897. I was wondering why it took so long for the military to show up but it must have taken a while for the news to spread back then. Iâ€™m planning on listening to the Orson Welles radio broadcast and maybe rewatching the Spielberg movie sometime soon. (ğŸ‘ğŸ¼)

ğŸ•¹ï¸ Puzzmo. New game service by Zach Gage and Orta Therox that is trying to compete with the likes of The New York Times' games offering. There is a lot to love here. The new game, Flipart, has become my go to game when I wake up in the morning. Give this a shot if you like newspaper games of all kinds. (â¤ï¸)

ğŸ•¹ï¸ Playdate. I received a Playdate as a 2022 Christmas gift but only just received it. I have been addicted to the thing since I opened the box. The hardware is solid and the crank has a great feel. My favorite type of games are short, twitchy, skill based games that I can beat in a few days and this has those types of games by the bucketload. (â¤ï¸)

ğŸ¿ Mission Impossible: Dead Reconning Part One. The action sequences in this movie were great fun. I think I have enjoyed the Mission Impossible series more than the James Bond franchise in recent years. This does suffer a bit by being a Part 1 of 2 movie, and Iâ€™m not sure this was really necessary for this story line. That said, I will be watching the next one, if only to see Tom Cruise do another one of his insane stunts. (ğŸ‘ğŸ¼)

ğŸ“– Starter Villain by John Scalzi. Just the book I needed after reading a few slower books. Scalzi is always a great popcorn-type read and I blasted through this in a few days. Just like every other book of his. Iâ€™m hoping he can get back to a series of books again sometime soon. (ğŸ‘ğŸ¼)

ğŸ“º Scavengers Reign. Wow. Started this show on a whim after seeing a Threads post about it. I devoured it on a lazy weekend while Emily was doing pottery. Creative sci-fi with life forms reminiscent of Adventure Time mixed with a very adult, somber, but heartfelt storyline. More like this please! (â¤ï¸)

ğŸ¿ Napoleon. I was really looking forward to this and was a bit let down. Joaquin Phoenix is great in the role but there was something missing. Watch this on Apple Plus instead of the theater. (ğŸ«¤)

ğŸ“º Blue Eye Samurai. This anime was a nice surprise. The animation was incredible and it reminded me Avatar: The Last Airbender grown up (with way more violence and none of the magic qualities). Very much looking forward to Season 2. (â¤ï¸)

ğŸ¿ Elemental. Weâ€™ve been putting this movie off and finally, begrudgingly, fired it up on a lazy Saturday night. Has Pixar ever tackled a love story head on quite like this? The animation was fantastic as usual and I had very few gripes. (ğŸ‘ğŸ¼)

ğŸ•¹ï¸ Bramble: The Mountain King. The story was engaging but the control scheme left something to be desired. Too clunky. Iâ€™d still recommend this tho as it was quite short and not that difficult. A fun weekend romp and free on Game Pass. (ğŸ«¤)

ğŸ“– The Metamorphosis by Franz Kafka. Iâ€™ll be honest and say that I started this book purely because it was short and Iâ€™m making a last ditch effort to complete my reading goal for the year. Recognizing the fact that it was written in 1915 and translated from German, it wasâ€¦ fine. Though, I did particularly like the resulting metamorphosis of the family after the death of Gregor. (ğŸ«¤)

ğŸï¸ 2023 F1 Season. Fun season, even if it was predetermined that Max would win. (ğŸ‘ğŸ¼)

ğŸ¿ Blue Beetle. I expected this to be generic and I wasnâ€™t wrong. I think they infused it with enough charm that I did enjoy watching enough that I didnâ€™t regret it. (ğŸ«¤)

ğŸ¿ Cobweb. This has been on my horror radar for a while now and I was looking forward to it. It let me down a bit. Malignant did it better. (ğŸ«¤)

ğŸ¿ Shin Godzilla. Bought this on sale a long time ago and finally got around to watching. Evolving Godzilla is a great concept. The initial form is so wacky and off the wall that youâ€™re exited for future evolutions. (ğŸ‘ğŸ¼)
items.content_text:
I am a huge fan of Jason Kottke and his website, [kottke.org](https://kottke.org). Periodically, Jason posts a summary of what he's been watching, reading, playing, and doing. I look forward to these posts and thought it would be fun to start doing the same.

I am hoping that writing about the content I consume will allow me to reflect on and remember more of what I enjoy (or don't enjoy).

So without further ado, here is what I've been up to the past month:

**ğŸ¿ [Nosferatu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nosferatu).** Somehow I had never seen Nosferatu prior to this. Nitehawk Theater screened a restoration with a live score played by a band on Halloween night. It was the perfect way to see it for the first time. (ğŸ‘ğŸ¼)

**ğŸ“º [Our Flag Means Death](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Our_Flag_Means_Death).** Love this show. Very sweet, very fun. Taikaâ€™s comedic timing is unmatched. Iâ€™m hoping it gets picked up for a third season but they ended this one in a way thatâ€™s fitting even if it does not. (ğŸ‘ğŸ¼)

**ğŸ“º [The Sopranos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sopranos).** I was very late to the game despite loving all things organized crime. What is there to say that hasnâ€™t already been said about Tony Soprano and the rest of the ensemble cast that makes up this show? James Gandolfini embodies Tony Soprano in a way that so many actors wish they could emulate but can never achieve. The show isnâ€™t perfect but it has quickly climbed to one of the top spots in my favorite shows of all time list. (â¤ï¸)

**ğŸ“º [Pluto](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt26737616/).** I have never read or watched any Astro Boy content before this. Pluto was a wonderful take on robots / AI coming to terms with its own humanity. Iâ€™d love to watch more content in this vein. Pluto reminded me of a cross between Blade Runner and Neon Genesis Evangelion. (ğŸ‘ğŸ¼)

**ğŸ“– [The War Of The Worlds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_War_of_the_Worlds) by H.G. Wells.** I try to read a few â€œclassicsâ€ every year. I did not realize this was written in 1897. I was wondering why it took so long for the military to show up but it must have taken a while for the news to spread back then. Iâ€™m planning on listening to the Orson Welles radio broadcast and maybe rewatching the Spielberg movie sometime soon. (ğŸ‘ğŸ¼)

**ğŸ•¹ï¸ [Puzzmo](https://www.puzzmo.com).** New game service by Zach Gage and Orta Therox that is trying to compete with the likes of The New York Times' games offering. There is a lot to love here. The new game, Flipart, has become my go to game when I wake up in the morning. Give this a shot if you like newspaper games of all kinds. (â¤ï¸)

**ğŸ•¹ï¸ [Playdate](https://play.date).** I received a Playdate as a 2022 Christmas gift but only just received it. I have been addicted to the thing since I opened the box. The hardware is solid and the crank has a great feel. My favorite type of games are short, twitchy, skill based games that I can beat in a few days and this has those types of games by the bucketload. (â¤ï¸)

**ğŸ¿ [Mission Impossible: Dead Reconning Part One](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mission:_Impossible_â€“_Dead_Reckoning_Part_One).** The action sequences in this movie were great fun. I think I have enjoyed the Mission Impossible series more than the James Bond franchise in recent years. This does suffer a bit by being a Part 1 of 2 movie, and Iâ€™m not sure this was really necessary for this story line. That said, I will be watching the next one, if only to see Tom Cruise do another one of his insane stunts. (ğŸ‘ğŸ¼)

**ğŸ“– [Starter Villain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Starter_Villain) by John Scalzi.** Just the book I needed after reading a few slower books. Scalzi is always a great popcorn-type read and I blasted through this in a few days. Just like every other book of his. Iâ€™m hoping he can get back to a series of books again sometime soon. (ğŸ‘ğŸ¼)

**ğŸ“º [Scavengers Reign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scavengers_Reign).** Wow. Started this show on a whim after seeing a Threads post about it. I devoured it on a lazy weekend while Emily was doing pottery. Creative sci-fi with life forms reminiscent of Adventure Time mixed with a very adult, somber, but heartfelt storyline. More like this please! (â¤ï¸)

**ğŸ¿ [Napoleon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Napoleon_(2023_film)).** I was really looking forward to this and was a bit let down. Joaquin Phoenix is great in the role but there was something missing. Watch this on Apple Plus instead of the theater. (ğŸ«¤)

**ğŸ“º [Blue Eye Samurai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blue_Eye_Samurai).** This anime was a nice surprise. The animation was incredible and it reminded me Avatar: The Last Airbender grown up (with way more violence and none of the magic qualities). Very much looking forward to Season 2. (â¤ï¸)

**ğŸ¿ [Elemental](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elemental_(2023_film)).** Weâ€™ve been putting this movie off and finally, begrudgingly, fired it up on a lazy Saturday night. Has Pixar ever tackled a love story head on quite like this? The animation was fantastic as usual and I had very few gripes. (ğŸ‘ğŸ¼)

**ğŸ•¹ï¸ [Bramble: The Mountain King](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bramble:_The_Mountain_King).** The story was engaging but the control scheme left something to be desired. Too clunky. Iâ€™d still recommend this tho as it was quite short and not that difficult. A fun weekend romp and free on Game Pass. (ğŸ«¤)

**ğŸ“– [The Metamorphosis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Metamorphosis) by Franz Kafka.** Iâ€™ll be honest and say that I started this book purely because it was short and Iâ€™m making a last ditch effort to complete my reading goal for the year. Recognizing the fact that it was written in 1915 and translated from German, it wasâ€¦ fine. Though, I did particularly like the resulting metamorphosis of the family after the death of Gregor. (ğŸ«¤)

**ğŸï¸ [2023 F1 Season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2023_Formula_One_World_Championship).** Fun season, even if it was predetermined that Max would win. (ğŸ‘ğŸ¼)

**ğŸ¿ [Blue Beetle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blue_Beetle_(film)).** I expected this to be generic and I wasnâ€™t wrong. I think they infused it with enough charm that I did enjoy watching enough that I didnâ€™t regret it. (ğŸ«¤)

**ğŸ¿ [Cobweb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cobweb_(2023_American_film)).** This has been on my horror radar for a while now and I was looking forward to it. It let me down a bit. Malignant did it better. (ğŸ«¤)

**ğŸ¿ [Shin Godzilla](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shin_Godzilla).** Bought this on sale a long time ago and finally got around to watching. Evolving Godzilla is a great concept. The initial form is so wacky and off the wall that youâ€™re exited for future evolutions. (ğŸ‘ğŸ¼)

items.content_html: Last night I attended an LCD Soundsystem show. Great time. But Iâ€™ve sustained some serious ringing and muffling in my hearing. Itâ€™s gotten a bit better since last night and Iâ€™m not overly concerned. Next time I go to a concert Iâ€™m definitely bringing earplugs.
items.content_text: Last night I attended an LCD Soundsystem show. Great time. But Iâ€™ve sustained some serious ringing and muffling in my hearing. Itâ€™s gotten a bit better since last night and Iâ€™m not overly concerned. Next time I go to a concert Iâ€™m definitely bringing earplugs.

items.title: iOS Notification Center Bug
items.content_html:
When I started this blog, my intention was to resist the urge to use it as an outlet for complaining. The tech commentator world is full enough of that already and I donâ€™t need another space to vent.

BUT. Iâ€™ve got a bone to pick with one specific iOS bug thatâ€™s bothered me for years and yet Iâ€™ve never seen anyone else mention it:

When Notification Center presents itself, notifications are briefly shown with square corners before re-rendering with rounded corners.

This issue has happened daily for over a year now and through multiple major iOS updates.

Has anyone else experienced this with the same frequency as me? Whatâ€™s your pet bug that kills you inside?

Someone send help. ğŸ˜…
items.content_text:
When I started this blog, my intention was to resist the urge to use it as an outlet for complaining. The tech commentator world is full enough of that already and I donâ€™t need another space to vent. 

BUT. Iâ€™ve got a bone to pick with one specific iOS bug thatâ€™s bothered me for years and yet Iâ€™ve never seen anyone else mention it:

When Notification Center presents itself, notifications are briefly shown with square corners before re-rendering with rounded corners. 

This issue has happened daily for over a year now and through multiple major iOS updates.

Has anyone else experienced this with the same frequency as me? Whatâ€™s your pet bug that kills you inside?

Someone send help. ğŸ˜…

items.content_html: Scavengers Reign on Max is an amazing piece of Sci-Fi. Do not miss this show. Iâ€™m so happy I started watching this and cannot wait to finish it.
items.content_text: Scavengers Reign on Max is an amazing piece of Sci-Fi. Do not miss this show. Iâ€™m so happy I started watching this and cannot wait to finish it.

items.content_html:
Iâ€™m excited for Apple to update messages to included the RCS spec. However, I fully expect them to implement some minimal functionality that keeps iMessage the superior experience.

I donâ€™t think the green bubble stigma is going away anytime soon.
items.content_text:
Iâ€™m excited for Apple to update messages to included the RCS spec. However, I fully expect them to implement some minimal functionality that keeps iMessage the superior experience.

items.content_html: I planned on reading 20 books this year. Iâ€™m not sure Iâ€™m going to reach this goal. I know itâ€™s not a big deal but it bums me out to miss this goal for the first time in years. ğŸ«¤
items.content_text: I planned on reading 20 books this year. Iâ€™m not sure Iâ€™m going to reach this goal. I know itâ€™s not a big deal but it bums me out to miss this goal for the first time in years. ğŸ«¤

items.content_html:
Iâ€™m really enjoying Puzzmo, Zach Gage and Orta Theroxâ€™s new puzzle service thatâ€™s taking on the likes of the NYT crosswords and related games. The interface is slick and I love being able to play and compete with my friends and family.

How many Moms are on Puzzmo besides mine? ğŸ˜‚

items.content_html: I have next to zero interest in the little AI pin that Humane is putting out. I fail to see its benefits over the devices we already have strapped to our wrists or in our pockets. I welcome the competition but itâ€™s an uphill battle for sure. Who is the target market for this? Will I ever see one in the wild?
items.content_text: I have next to zero interest in the little AI pin that Humane is putting out. I fail to see its benefits over the devices we already have strapped to our wrists or in our pockets. I welcome the competition but itâ€™s an uphill battle for sure. Who is the target market for this? Will I ever see one in the wild?

items.content_html:
I bought an M2 Max MBP earlier this year. I was initially bummed that the M3 Max seemed like a significant leap forward but got over it quickly as even the M2 Max is overkill for my use case.

Today, I learned that the new MBPs charge at 140W over USB-C and Iâ€™m back to being a bit salty. ğŸ˜…
items.content_text:
I bought an M2 Max MBP earlier this year. I was initially bummed that the M3 Max seemed like a significant leap forward but got over it quickly as even the M2 Max is overkill for my use case.

Today, I learned that the new MBPs charge at 140W over USB-C and Iâ€™m back to being a bit salty. ğŸ˜…

items.title: My App Defaults
items.content_html:
Recently, folks have been sharing their default apps in a bunch of different categories. (Iâ€™m told the podcast Hemispheric Views started this. I plan on listening soon.)

Iâ€™m a sucker for learning about other peopleâ€™s workflows and seeing how I can make better use of my time, so this was right up my alley.

In recent years I have drastically simplified the amount of third party apps I use. I felt like I was on a hamster wheel of finding and using the latest mail client, RSS reader, to-do list, etc.

I still keep my ear to the ground about the hot new productivity app but I have to be really sure itâ€™s sticking around before I swap away from the default Apple option. Appleâ€™s apps donâ€™t always have the latest flashy features but I generally expect them to be around for the next five years.

Without further adieu, here are my default apps:

ğŸ“¨ Mail Client

  • Apple Mail

ğŸ“® Mail Server

  • GSuite (Is it still called this? Iâ€™m considering switching to FastMail but havenâ€™t pulled the trigger yet.)

ğŸ“ Notes

  • Apple Notes

âœ… To-Do

  • Apple Reminders

ğŸ“· iPhone Photo Shooting

  • Apple Camera

ğŸŸ¦ Photo Management

  • iCloud Photos / Apple Photos

ğŸ“† Calendar

  • Fantastical

ğŸ“ Cloud File Storage

  • iCloud Drive

ğŸ“– RSS

  • N/A (I used Feedbin after the death of Google Reader but I no longer use RSS much at all anymore.)

ğŸ™ğŸ»â€â™‚ï¸ Contacts

  • Apple Contacts

ğŸŒ Browser

  • Safari / Firefox / Chrome in that order.

ğŸ’¬ Chat

  • Apple Messages and one Slack

ğŸ”– Bookmarks

  • N/A (I usually save links in Apple Reminders or Apple Notes, depending on the context.)

ğŸ“‘ Read It Later

  • Ephemera (This one is my app. Itâ€™s simple and unique. Check it out!)

ğŸ“œ Word Processing

  • Apple Notes / TextEdit / Pages

ğŸ“ˆ Spreadsheets

  • Numbers (I would use Excel in a heartbeat if I had any services spreadsheeting to do.)

ğŸ“Š Presentations

  • N/A

ğŸ›’ Shopping Lists

  • Apple Reminders

ğŸ´ Meal Planning

  • Mela

ğŸ’° Budgeting and Personal Finance

  • Copilot (Iâ€™m not convinced this is the app for me. Itâ€™s pretty but the Fidelity integration does not work. Iâ€™m fielding suggestions. Let me know!)

ğŸ“° News

  • Apple News

ğŸµ Music

  • Apple Music

ğŸ¤ Podcasts

  • Overcast

ğŸ” Password Management

  • 1Password (Thinking about switching to the native keychain implementation, but Iâ€™ve got my family on the 1Password family plan and it sounds like a pain in the butt for me to switch.)

Recently, folks have been sharing their default apps in a bunch of different categories. (Iâ€™m told the podcast [Hemispheric Views](https://hemisphericviews.com/) started this. I plan on listening soon.)

Iâ€™m a sucker for learning about other peopleâ€™s workflows and seeing how I can make better use of my time, so this was right up my alley.

In recent years I have drastically simplified the amount of third party apps I use. I felt like I was on a hamster wheel of finding and using the latest mail client, RSS reader, to-do list, etc. 

I still keep my ear to the ground about the hot new productivity app but I have to be really sure itâ€™s sticking around before I swap away from the default Apple option. Appleâ€™s apps donâ€™t always have the latest flashy features but I generally expect them to be around for the next five years.

items.content_html:
Hello!

I am going to try posting a bit here. I have always struggled to keep a blogging routine. My plan is to treat it a lot more causally than I have in the past.

Let the fun (and posting) begin!
items.content_text:

I am going to try posting a bit here. I have always struggled to keep a blogging routine. My plan is to treat it a lot more causally than I have in the past. 

Let the fun (and posting) begin!
